name: Appetite
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: The Appetite determination relates to eating based on hunger signals and selective food choices. This is about eating what your body craves in the moment, following genuine appetite rather than schedules or plans.
physicalApplication: Eat only when genuinely hungry. Let your body's natural appetite guide what and when you eat. Be selective about food‚Äîyour body knows what it needs.
environmentalSupport: Private or quiet eating environments where you can tune into your body's signals without distraction
challenges: Eating on schedule when not hungry
practicalGuidance: Pay attention to what your body actually wants to eat. Don't force meals when you're not hungry. Your appetite is intelligent‚Äîtrust it.

name: Taste
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: Taste determination means your body processes food best when you can fully taste and savor it. Eating should be a sensory experience where you're present with flavors.
physicalApplication: Eat slowly and mindfully, savoring each bite. Choose foods with distinct, satisfying flavors. Avoid eating while distracted‚Äîtaste needs your full attention.
environmentalSupport: Calm, pleasant environments where you can focus on the eating experience without rushing
practicalGuidance: Your digestion works best when you truly taste your food. Make meals an experience. If you can't taste it properly, your body won't process it optimally.

name: Thirst
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: Thirst determination indicates that hydration plays a crucial role in your digestion. Water and liquid intake are essential partners to your food consumption.
physicalApplication: Drink water before, during, or after meals as your body indicates. Pay attention to thirst signals. Soups, broths, and water-rich foods support your digestion.
environmentalSupport: Access to clean water and an awareness of your body's hydration needs throughout the day
practicalGuidance: Your relationship with water is key to your wellbeing. Stay hydrated and include liquid-rich foods. Don't ignore thirst signals‚Äîthey're connected to your overall digestion.

name: Touch
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: Touch determination means texture matters profoundly for your digestion. The physical feel of food‚Äîcrunchy, smooth, chewy‚Äîimpacts how well you process it.
physicalApplication: Pay attention to food textures. Notice which textures feel satisfying versus off-putting. Vary textures in your meals for optimal satisfaction.
environmentalSupport: Foods prepared with attention to texture, environments where you can physically engage with your food
practicalGuidance: Texture is your guide. If a food texture feels wrong, your body is telling you something. Experiment with different textures to find what supports your digestion best.

name: Sound
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: Sound determination indicates that the auditory environment during eating affects your digestion. Sounds of food (crunching, sizzling) and ambient noise matter.
physicalApplication: Notice how different sound environments affect your eating experience. Some need silence to eat well; others digest better with pleasant background sounds.
environmentalSupport: Control over your auditory environment during meals‚Äîwhether that means quiet or specific types of sound
challenges: Jarring or stressful sounds during meals
Unable to control eating environment acoustics
practicalGuidance: Pay attention to how sounds affect your eating. Create an auditory environment that supports your digestion, whether that's silence, music, or natural sounds.

name: Light
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: Light determination means lighting conditions during eating affect your digestion. Natural light, dim light, or specific lighting conditions optimize your food processing.
physicalApplication: Notice how different lighting affects your eating. Some digest best in natural daylight; others prefer softer, dimmer lighting during meals.
environmentalSupport: Control over lighting during meals‚Äîaccess to natural light or ability to adjust artificial lighting
practicalGuidance: Lighting isn't just about seeing your food‚Äîit affects your entire digestive process. Experiment with different lighting conditions to find what supports you best.

name: Open Taste
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: Open Taste is the receptive version of taste determination. You're designed to be exposed to a wide variety of flavors and cuisines. Dietary openness supports your digestion.
physicalApplication: Explore diverse cuisines and flavors. Be adventurous with food. Your body thrives on variety rather than routine eating patterns.
environmentalSupport: Access to diverse food options, cultural variety in cuisine, social eating situations that expose you to new foods
practicalGuidance: Your digestion is stimulated by novelty. Don't get stuck in food ruts. Let others introduce you to new flavors and cuisines‚Äîyour body loves the variety.

name: Nervous
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: Nervous determination indicates that your nervous system state directly affects digestion. You need to feel safe and calm to eat well‚Äîor may eat better with slight stimulation.
physicalApplication: Notice your nervous system state before eating. Create conditions that help you feel safe. Some process food better with gentle movement or mild activity around meals.
environmentalSupport: Eating environments that feel safe and regulate your nervous system appropriately
practicalGuidance: Your nervous system and digestion are deeply connected. Don't eat when you're stressed if you can help it. Find what calms your system before meals.

name: High Sound
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: High Sound determination means you digest best with active, vibrant sound environments. Bustling restaurants, conversation, or lively atmospheres support your eating.
physicalApplication: Eat in social or lively environments. Background activity, conversation, and ambient sound actually support your digestion rather than distract from it.
environmentalSupport: Busy cafes, family dinners, social eating situations with conversation and ambient activity
practicalGuidance: You're designed for communal eating. The energy of others and ambient activity actually helps you digest. Seek out social meals when possible.

name: Direct Light
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: Direct Light determination indicates you need bright, direct lighting to eat optimally. Outdoor eating in daylight or well-lit spaces support your digestion.
physicalApplication: Eat in well-lit environments. Outdoor meals in natural light are ideal. Avoid dim, dark eating spaces when possible.
environmentalSupport: Outdoor dining, bright restaurants, spaces with abundant natural light during meals
challenges: Eating at night in low light
practicalGuidance: Light energizes your digestion. Seek bright environments for meals. If eating at night, ensure good lighting. Consider breakfast or lunch as your main meals.

name: Wet
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: Wet determination indicates a need for hot, cooked, wet foods. Soups, stews, steamed vegetables, and warm beverages support your digestion best.
physicalApplication: Emphasize cooked, moist foods. Soups, stews, porridges, and steamed dishes are ideal. Avoid excessive raw or dry foods.
environmentalSupport: Access to home cooking, warm meal preparation, quality soups and stews
practicalGuidance: Your body processes wet, cooked foods best. Invest in warm meal preparation. Soups can be medicine for you‚Äîmake them a dietary staple.

name: Dry
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: Dry determination indicates you process food best when it's dry, raw, or minimally processed. Fresh fruits, vegetables, nuts, and dried foods support your digestion.
physicalApplication: Include raw and dry foods‚Äîsalads, fresh fruits, nuts, dehydrated foods. You don't need everything cooked and warm; your body handles raw well.
environmentalSupport: Access to fresh produce, quality raw foods, minimal processing in food preparation
practicalGuidance: Your digestion works well with raw and dry foods. Don't force yourself to eat hot meals if your body prefers fresh, raw options. Listen to that preference.

name: Hot
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: Hot determination means you need your food at warm or hot temperatures. Cold foods slow your digestion; warmth activates it.
physicalApplication: Eat warm and hot foods. Avoid cold drinks with meals. Let refrigerated food come to room temperature or warm it before eating.
environmentalSupport: Kitchen access for warming food, avoiding excessive refrigerated meals, warm beverage habits
practicalGuidance: Temperature matters for you. Don't eat cold leftovers straight from the fridge. Take time to warm your food‚Äîyour body will thank you.

name: Cold
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: Cold determination indicates that cold or room temperature foods work well for your digestion. You don't need everything heated‚Äîcool and raw foods support you.
physicalApplication: Include cold and room temperature foods. Salads, cold beverages, chilled dishes, and raw foods can be primary rather than occasional.
environmentalSupport: Access to fresh, cold foods, quality salads and raw preparations, cold beverage options
practicalGuidance: Your body doesn't need everything warm. Cold foods and drinks can actually support your digestion. Trust this even if it goes against common dietary advice.

name: Calm
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: Calm determination means you need peaceful, serene environments to eat well. Stress during eating directly impairs your digestion.
physicalApplication: Create calm eating environments. Avoid eating while stressed, working, or in conflict. Peace is essential for your digestive process.
environmentalSupport: Quiet dining spaces, absence of conflict or stress during meals, mindful eating practices
practicalGuidance: Your nervous system must be calm for optimal digestion. If stressed, consider skipping a meal rather than eating in that state. Peace first, food second.

name: Alternating
categoryDescription: How your body is designed to take in and process food and nutrition
description: Alternating determination indicates your dietary needs shift in cycles. Sometimes you need one type of food; other times, the opposite. Flexibility is key.
physicalApplication: Don't lock yourself into rigid dietary rules. Notice how your needs shift over days, weeks, or seasons. What works now may not work later‚Äîand that's correct for you.
environmentalSupport: Dietary freedom, access to variety, permission to change eating patterns
practicalGuidance: Your body's needs naturally alternate. One week you might crave hot foods; the next, cold. Trust these shifts‚Äîthey're intelligent. Don't force consistency.

name: Smell
categoryDescription: How you are designed to perceive and take in information from the world
description: Smell cognition means you literally perceive information through scent and metaphorically through 'sniffing out' what's correct. Your sense of smell guides awareness.
mentalApplication: Trust your nose‚Äîboth literally and figuratively. When something 'smells off,' pay attention. Your olfactory sense is connected to deep intuitive knowing.
perceptionStrength: Ability to sense what's 'off' or 'right' before logic confirms it
practicalGuidance: Your cognition works through scent awareness. Notice how smells affect your perception. When you sense something is 'off,' investigate before dismissing it.

name: Taste
categoryDescription: How you are designed to perceive and take in information from the world
description: Taste cognition means you perceive information through discernment and selection. You have refined taste in ideas, people, and experiences‚Äîand should trust it.
mentalApplication: Trust your taste. When something doesn't 'taste right'‚Äîan idea, a person, a decision‚Äîhonor that discrimination. Your selectivity is intelligent.
perceptionStrength: Ability to distinguish quality and appropriateness in subtle ways
practicalGuidance: Your cognition is discriminating. You naturally taste what's quality versus mediocre. Trust this even when others don't understand your selectivity.

name: Outer Vision
categoryDescription: How you are designed to perceive and take in information from the world
description: Outer Vision cognition means you perceive through watching the external world. You're designed to observe patterns, movement, and visual information in your environment.
mentalApplication: Watch what's happening around you. Your visual perception of external events gives you information. You learn by observing rather than just thinking.
perceptionStrength: Ability to notice what's happening in your environment and spot visual patterns
practicalGuidance: Keep your eyes on the external world. Your cognition works through watching. If you need clarity, look around‚Äîthe visual environment holds information for you.

name: Inner Vision
categoryDescription: How you are designed to perceive and take in information from the world
description: Inner Vision cognition means you perceive through internal visualization. Closing your eyes, imagining, and inner seeing are how you process information.
mentalApplication: Close your eyes to think. Visualize scenarios internally. Your cognition works best when you turn inward and see with your mind's eye.
perceptionStrength: Ability to visualize, imagine, and see possibilities internally
practicalGuidance: Your cognition needs inner space. Close your eyes, visualize, imagine. Major decisions deserve internal visualization time‚Äîyour inner vision shows you possibilities.

name: Feeling
categoryDescription: How you are designed to perceive and take in information from the world
description: Feeling cognition means you perceive through emotional and physical feeling states. Your body's feelings carry information‚Äîsensations, emotions, and felt sense guide you.
mentalApplication: Check how things feel in your body. Emotions and physical sensations are data. When making decisions, notice what you feel rather than just what you think.
perceptionStrength: Ability to sense through feeling states what the mind alone cannot know
practicalGuidance: Your cognition is feeling-based. When you need to know something, ask yourself: 'How does this feel?' Your feelings carry intelligent information.

name: Touch
categoryDescription: How you are designed to perceive and take in information from the world
description: Touch cognition means you perceive through physical contact and tactile sensation. You need to touch, hold, and physically engage to truly know something.
mentalApplication: Get hands-on. Touch and handle things. Your cognition works through physical contact‚Äîabstract thinking isn't your primary mode. Make things tangible.
perceptionStrength: Ability to know things through direct physical engagement and touch
practicalGuidance: Your cognition is tactile. If you can't touch it, you can't fully know it. Get your hands on things. Physical engagement is how you learn and process.

name: Peripheral Outer Vision
categoryDescription: How you are designed to perceive and take in information from the world
description: Peripheral Outer Vision means you perceive what's happening at the edges of your awareness. You catch things in your peripheral vision‚Äîmetaphorically and literally.
mentalApplication: Don't focus too hard. Soften your gaze and notice what's happening at the edges. Important information comes to you peripherally, not through direct focus.
perceptionStrength: Ability to catch important information that others miss by being peripherally aware
practicalGuidance: Your cognition works at the edges. If you focus too hard, you miss things. Soften your visual and mental attention‚Äîlet information come to your periphery.

name: Focused Inner Vision
categoryDescription: How you are designed to perceive and take in information from the world
description: Focused Inner Vision means you perceive through concentrated internal visualization. Deep, focused meditation and single-pointed inner seeing serve your cognition.
mentalApplication: Focus your inner vision with intention. Concentrated visualization, meditation, and deliberate mental imagery are your cognitive tools.
perceptionStrength: Ability to penetrate deeply through concentrated inner focus
practicalGuidance: Your cognition needs concentrated inner time. Find ways to focus your inner vision without distraction. Deep meditation and visualization serve you.

name: Acceptance
categoryDescription: How you are designed to perceive and take in information from the world
description: Acceptance cognition means you perceive by allowing and accepting what is. Non-resistance and receptivity open your awareness. Fighting reality closes your cognition.
mentalApplication: Accept what's happening before trying to change it. Your cognition opens through acceptance and closes through resistance. Receive before you react.
perceptionStrength: Ability to perceive truth by accepting rather than resisting
practicalGuidance: Your cognition works through acceptance. When you resist, you can't perceive clearly. Accept first, then respond. Resistance blinds; acceptance illuminates.

name: Sensation
categoryDescription: How you are designed to perceive and take in information from the world
description: Sensation cognition means you perceive through pure sensory experience. Raw sensation‚Äîbefore interpretation‚Äîis your cognitive gateway. Stay with sensation.
mentalApplication: Notice pure sensation before you label it. Your cognition works at the level of raw sensory input, before the mind interprets. Stay sensory.
perceptionStrength: Ability to perceive reality through direct sensation without mental overlay
practicalGuidance: Your cognition lives in sensation. Before you think about something, feel it as sensation. This raw sensory awareness is your truest perception.

name: Caves
categoryDescription: The type of physical environment that supports your success and wellbeing
description: Caves environment means you thrive in enclosed, protected spaces with limited entry points. You need to feel contained and secure in your physical environment.
physicalApplication: Create nest-like spaces. Work in rooms with doors that close. Have your back to a wall. Limit how people can enter your space. Containment supports you.
practicalGuidance: Your success depends on feeling contained. If your environment is too open, you can't function optimally. Create cave-like spaces wherever you work and live.

name: Markets
categoryDescription: The type of physical environment that supports your success and wellbeing
description: Markets environment means you thrive where there's exchange and selection happening. Busy places with variety, options, and commerce suit you.
physicalApplication: Position yourself where exchange happens. Coffee shops, marketplaces, co-working spaces with activity. You need options and flow around you.
practicalGuidance: You need to be where selection and exchange happen. Markets‚Äîliteral or metaphorical‚Äîenergize your system. Don't isolate yourself from activity.

name: Kitchens
categoryDescription: The type of physical environment that supports your success and wellbeing
description: Kitchens environment means you thrive where transformation and preparation happen. Spaces where things are made, cooked, or transformed support your functioning.
physicalApplication: Work in spaces where things are being created or transformed. Literal kitchens, labs, workshops, studios. The energy of transformation supports you.
practicalGuidance: You need to be where transformation happens. The kitchen is literal‚Äîand metaphorical. Work where things are being created, prepared, or changed.

name: Mountains
categoryDescription: The type of physical environment that supports your success and wellbeing
description: Mountains environment means you thrive with elevated perspective and overview. High places‚Äîphysically or metaphorically‚Äîsupport your success.
physicalApplication: Get up high. Upper floors, hills, elevated positions. You need to see the big picture literally‚Äîoverview and perspective support your functioning.
practicalGuidance: Height matters for you. Get to upper floors, find hills, seek elevation. When you can't see the overview, you can't function optimally. Perspective is essential.

name: Valleys
categoryDescription: The type of physical environment that supports your success and wellbeing
description: Valleys environment means you thrive in lower, acoustically contained spaces. Sound carries to you; you're designed to receive what flows down.
physicalApplication: Position yourself in lower areas where sound and energy collect. Ground floors, valleys, places where things naturally flow toward you.
practicalGuidance: You're designed to be in valleys‚Äîplaces where things collect and flow to you. Sound matters. Position yourself to receive rather than to overlook.

name: Shores
categoryDescription: The type of physical environment that supports your success and wellbeing
description: Shores environment means you thrive at boundaries and transitions. Where two things meet‚Äîland and water, inside and outside‚Äîyou function optimally.
physicalApplication: Position yourself at edges and transitions. Doorways, waterfronts, boundaries between environments. You're designed for threshold spaces.
practicalGuidance: You belong at shores‚Äîwhere things meet. Seek boundary positions, transitional spaces, edges. You function best where two environments touch.

name: Selective Caves
categoryDescription: The type of physical environment that supports your success and wellbeing
description: Selective Caves environment means you need enclosed spaces but with careful selection. Not just any cave‚Äîthe right enclosed space specifically suits you.
physicalApplication: Be selective about your enclosed spaces. The cave matters‚Äîchoose carefully where you contain yourself. Quality of enclosure matters as much as enclosure itself.
practicalGuidance: You need enclosure, but you're selective. Not any cave will do‚Äîyou need to choose your enclosed spaces carefully. Quality and fit matter.

name: Blending Shores
categoryDescription: The type of physical environment that supports your success and wellbeing
description: Blending Shores environment means you thrive where environments blur together. Not sharp boundaries but gradual transitions where things blend.
physicalApplication: Seek spaces where inside and outside blend, where transitions are gradual rather than sharp. Screened porches, open-plan spaces with flow.
practicalGuidance: You need environments that blend. Seek gradual transitions, soft boundaries, spaces where inside and outside connect rather than separate.

name: Fear
categoryDescription: What naturally motivates your mind's focus and attention
description: Fear motivation means your mind is naturally motivated by security concerns. You're designed to think about survival, safety, and what could go wrong.
mentalApplication: Your mind naturally focuses on potential dangers and survival. This isn't neurosis‚Äîit's your design. Use this awareness to prepare and protect.
healthyExpression: Intelligent preparation, realistic risk assessment, protective planning
unhealthyExpression: Anxiety, paranoia, over-worry, paralysis from fear
challenges: Letting fear become anxiety rather than preparation
practicalGuidance: Your mind is wired for fear-based thinking‚Äîand that's okay. The key is channeling this into healthy preparation rather than anxious worry. Fear is fuel for smart planning.

name: Hope
categoryDescription: What naturally motivates your mind's focus and attention
description: Hope motivation means your mind is naturally motivated by possibility and positive outcomes. You're designed to think about what could go right.
mentalApplication: Your mind naturally focuses on possibilities and positive futures. This optimistic orientation is your design. Use it to envision and create.
healthyExpression: Constructive optimism, possibility thinking, inspiring vision
unhealthyExpression: Denial of problems, unrealistic expectations, hope without action
challenges: Ignoring real problems in favor of hope
practicalGuidance: Your mind naturally gravitates toward hope and possibility. This is a gift‚Äîuse it for vision and inspiration while staying grounded in reality.

name: Desire
categoryDescription: What naturally motivates your mind's focus and attention
description: Desire motivation means your mind is naturally motivated by want and craving. You're designed to think about what you desire and want to attain.
mentalApplication: Your mind naturally focuses on desires and wants. This craving nature is your design‚Äîuse it as fuel for achievement rather than frustration.
healthyExpression: Motivated pursuit, clear goals, passionate engagement
unhealthyExpression: Constant craving, never satisfied, attachment suffering
practicalGuidance: Your mind is motivated by desire. Rather than fighting this, channel it. Let desire fuel your pursuits while practicing letting go when needed.

name: Guilt
categoryDescription: What naturally motivates your mind's focus and attention
description: Guilt motivation means your mind is naturally motivated by conscience and moral consideration. You're designed to think about right and wrong, should and shouldn't.
mentalApplication: Your mind naturally focuses on ethical considerations and conscience. This moral awareness is your design‚Äîuse it for integrity, not self-punishment.
healthyExpression: Ethical living, moral courage, responsible action, integrity
unhealthyExpression: Chronic guilt, self-punishment, moral perfectionism, shame
practicalGuidance: Your mind is wired for guilt and moral awareness. Channel this into ethical living rather than self-punishment. Conscience is a guide, not a weapon.

name: Innocence
categoryDescription: What naturally motivates your mind's focus and attention
description: Innocence motivation means your mind is naturally motivated by purity and uncorrupted truth. You're designed to think with beginner's mind and fresh perspective.
mentalApplication: Your mind naturally seeks innocence and pure perception. This fresh perspective is your design‚Äîuse it to see what others miss through jaded eyes.
healthyExpression: Fresh eyes, wonder, unbiased perception, seeing truth simply
unhealthyExpression: Naivety, denial of complexity, refusal to mature
practicalGuidance: Your mind is motivated by innocence. This gives you fresh eyes‚Äîdon't let the world corrupt this. Your naive perspective often sees truths others miss.

name: Need
categoryDescription: What naturally motivates your mind's focus and attention
description: Need motivation means your mind is naturally motivated by necessity and what must be done. You're designed to think about requirements and essentials.
mentalApplication: Your mind naturally focuses on what's needed and necessary. This practical orientation is your design‚Äîuse it for prioritization and essentialism.
healthyExpression: Clear priorities, essentialism, meeting true needs, practical focus
unhealthyExpression: Feeling needy, scarcity mindset, confusing wants with needs
practicalGuidance: Your mind is motivated by need. Use this for clarity about what's truly necessary. Distinguish real needs from false ones and focus on what matters.

name: Communal Desire
categoryDescription: What naturally motivates your mind's focus and attention
description: Communal Desire motivation means your mind is motivated by shared wants and collective needs. You think about what the group desires, not just yourself.
mentalApplication: Your mind naturally focuses on what others want and need. This transpersonal desire is your design‚Äîuse it for service and contribution.
healthyExpression: Service orientation, meeting collective needs, contribution to others
unhealthyExpression: Losing yourself in others' wants, people-pleasing, boundary loss
practicalGuidance: Your mind is motivated by what others need. This is beautiful‚Äîbut don't lose yourself. Serve others while maintaining clarity about your own needs.

name: Personal Need
categoryDescription: What naturally motivates your mind's focus and attention
description: Personal Need motivation means your mind is focused on individual, personal necessities. You're designed to be clear about what you specifically need.
mentalApplication: Your mind naturally focuses on your personal needs. This self-awareness is your design‚Äîuse it for self-care and clear communication of needs.
healthyExpression: Clear self-knowledge, appropriate self-care, communicating needs
unhealthyExpression: Selfishness, inability to see others' needs, isolation
practicalGuidance: Your mind is motivated by personal need. Know what you need and communicate it clearly. This isn't selfish‚Äîit's honest self-awareness.
